intro: Orthaea breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered orthaea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a distinctive veining pattern. Orthaea breviflora is often found in shaded areas and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
